subsection_content_2: Canada. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency announced on September 27 that they had quarantined a farm in Saskatchewan where there is an outbreak of highly pathogenic H7N3 on a poultry farm. Officials are planning on euthanizing 50,000 chickens. The Minister of Agriculture and Agri-Food, Gerry Ritz, stated
subsection_content_1: Russia. Russia announced plans to develop a bird flu vaccine for wild birds within two years. Russia’s chief veterinarian at the food safety watchdog organization said that between 2% and 80% of the domestic birds culled test positive for “bird flu” and that “bird flu” has never really disappeared from Russia since 2005. However, the number of domestic
subsection_content_3: Bangladesh. Avian influenza has been detected on a farm in northern Bangladesh. The farmer submitted several chickens that had died on his farm for testing and avian influenza was detected. The subtype of avian influenza virus was not available. Around 6,000 chickens will be culled in the village. Since the discovery of bird flu at Savar, near the capital Dhaka in March, the virus has been detected in 18 of the country’s 64 districts.
subsection_header_3: "The most important thing to note at this time is that the domestic poultry industry is safe and free from H5N1, which has been associated with human illness, and that this H7N3 is unlikely to cause human sickness." Japan has banned poultry imported from Canada.
